what: 1) Convert a master file to FlyDreamR metadata
title: Getting data into FlyDreamR
text: Use convMasterToMeta() single master file, convMasterToMetaBatch() combine multiple master files one metadata table.
code: # Single master file -> metadata CSV metafile <- convMasterToMeta(   metafile = "master1.txt",   startDT  = "2025-02-12 06:04:00",   endDT    = "2025-02-17 06:04:00" )  # Multiple master files -> merged metadata CSV metafileBatch <- convMasterToMetaBatch(   c("master1.txt", "master2.txt"),   startDT = "2025-02-12 06:04:00",   endDT   = "2025-02-17 06:04:00" )

title: Getting data into FlyDreamR
text: Use HMMDataPrep() load monitor file(s) associated metadata CSV generate cleaned dataset. Demo dataset provided. resulting table can passed : calcTradSleep() traditional sleep metrics HMMbehavr() / HMMbehavrFast() HMM fitting
code: # Load demo data meta_file <- system.file("extdata", "Metadata_Monitor1.csv", package = "FlyDreamR") data_dir <- system.file("extdata", package = "FlyDreamR") dt <- HMMDataPrep(   metafile_path = meta_file,   result_dir    = data_dir,   ldcyc         = 12,   day_range     = c(1, 2) )  dt

title: HMM fitting and visualization
text: preparing dataset HMMDataPrep(), can fit HMM using: HMMbehavr() (single-threaded) HMMbehavrFast() (parallel; faster multi-core machines)
code: # Load demo data meta_file <- system.file("extdata", "Metadata_Monitor1.csv", package = "FlyDreamR") data_dir <- system.file("extdata", package = "FlyDreamR") dt <- HMMDataPrep(   metafile_path = meta_file,   result_dir    = data_dir,   ldcyc         = 12,   day_range     = c(1, 2) )  # Serial res <- HMMbehavr(behavtbl = dt, it = 100, ldcyc = 12)  # Parallel res_prl <- HMMbehavrFast(behavtbl = dt, it = 100, ldcyc = 12, n_cores = 4)

title: HMM fitting and visualization
text: FlyDreamR provides convenient plotting helpers: HMMplot() heatmap hypnograms HMMFacetedPlot() facet individual hypnograms HMMSinglePlot() save individual hypnograms disk
code: # Heatmap hypnograms HMMplot(res)  # Use a different built-in palette HMMplot(res, color_palette = "AG")  # Compare serial vs parallel fits library(patchwork) HMMplot(res, color_palette = "AG") / HMMplot(res_prl, color_palette = "AG")  # User-defined colors HMMplot(   res,   color_palette = "user",   user_colors = c(     "State0" = "#FF0060",     "State1" = "#F6FA70",     "State2" = "#00DFA2",     "State3" = "#0079FF"   ) )  # Faceted + save-to-disk helpers HMMFacetedPlot(res) HMMSinglePlot(res)

what: Prepare data with a sleep definition
title: Traditional sleep analyses
text: FlyDreamR lets define sleep immobility bouts minimum duration (e.g., 5 minutes, 60 minutes). Start preparing dataset HMMDataPrep() chosen min_time_immobile definition. calcTradSleep() returns list summary tables, including day/night breakdowns bout/latency statistics.
code: # Load demo data meta_file <- system.file("extdata", "Metadata_Monitor1.csv", package = "FlyDreamR") data_dir <- system.file("extdata", package = "FlyDreamR") # 5-minute sleep definition dt_5min <- HMMDataPrep(   metafile_path = meta_file,   result_dir    = data_dir,   ldcyc              = 12,   day_range          = c(1, 2),   min_time_immobile  = c(behavr::mins(5), behavr::mins(1440)) )  trad_5min <- calcTradSleep(dt_5min) trad_5min # 60-minute sleep definition dt_60min <- HMMDataPrep(   metafile_path = meta_file,   result_dir    = data_dir,   ldcyc              = 12,   day_range          = c(1, 2),   min_time_immobile  = c(behavr::mins(60), behavr::mins(1440)) )  trad_60min <- calcTradSleep(dt_60min) trad_60min

text: common plotting workflow uses ggetho (ethograms/profiles) ggplot2 summary visualizations.
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggetho)  # Somnogram-like ethogram ggetho::ggetho(dt_5min, mapping = aes(x = t, z = asleep)) +   ggetho::stat_bar_tile_etho()  # Sleep profile by genotype ggetho::ggetho(dt_5min, mapping = aes(x = t, y = asleep, color = genotype)) +   ggetho::stat_pop_etho()  # Facet by genotype + LD annotations ggetho::ggetho(dt_5min, mapping = aes(x = t, y = asleep, color = genotype)) +   ggetho::stat_pop_etho() +   ggplot2::facet_grid(genotype ~ .) +   ggetho::stat_ld_annotations()
